intro: Microsaccus brevifolius, commonly known as the short-leaved saccate, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are typically short and broad, with a slightly hairy texture. Microsaccus brevifolius thrives in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
